C

can$() - Method in class fullsoft.RegModel.RegModel
It is ok, if next model selector does not match anything.
char1(char) - Method in class fullsoft.RegModel.RegModel
Select next one character
Example:
private void char1() {
   String bigString = "Woooommmen.";
   RegModel regModel = new RegModel(bigString);
   regModel.char1('W'); //=> ok, selected model is 'W'
   regModel.chars(1,2,"o"); //=> ok, selected model is 'oo'
   regModel.chars(1,"moe"); //=> ok, selected model is 'oommme'
}
char1(String) - Method in class fullsoft.RegModel.RegModel
 
chars(int, String) - Method in class fullsoft.RegModel.RegModel
 
chars(String) - Method in class fullsoft.RegModel.RegModel
 
chars(int, int, String) - Method in class fullsoft.RegModel.RegModel

Example:
   String bigString = "Woooommmen.";
   RegModel regModel = new RegModel(bigString);
   regModel.chars("moW"); //=> ok, marked CharSequence is "Woooommm";
   regModel.fromStart$();
   regModel.chars( 0, -> minimal consecutive characters, 0 - means it is ok if is not
        3, -> maximal consecutive characters
        "33"); //=> ok, marked CharSequence is ""
   regModel.chars( 1, -> minimal consecutive characters, 1 - means at least one character
        3, -> maximal consecutive characters
        "moW"); //=> ok, marked CharSequence is 'Woooommm'
